As promised: Full story with all the details on #ldnont council #fanshawe #kingsmills deal http://t.co/vYWbI4EZg0
#Fanshawe deal goes through. More applause. We're writing. You'll all read that when it comes. right, #LdnOnt?
They're carving up this motion for various reasons, but it's clear the support for the money will go through. #LdnOnt #Fanshawe
Matt Brown is summing up. But Denise Brown was the one getting the applause. Thunder well and truly stolen. #LdnOnt
Denise Brown will support the #Fanshawe deal. That should be enough to get it through. And the public gallery explodes in applause. #LdnOnt
"I think the economic spin-offs are going to be positive and long-lasting." Denise Brown. #LdnOnt She is changing her mind, it seems.
"We always talk about community engagement. Well, I got it. I got it big time." Denise Brown on the many emails she's had. #LdnOnt
Now Coun. Denise Brown. Will she change her mind? #LdnOnt
Hubert is arguing for yes to #Fanshawe. That's six votes for each, with three not yet expressing an opinion tonight. #LdnOnt
Still to speak: Couns. Paul Hubert, Russ Monteith (yes last time), and Sandy White, Denise Brown (who said no). #LdnOnt
Coun. Paul Van Meerbergen provides the sixth "no". He doesn't want to fund education, talks of tight city budgets. #LdnOnt
So far: Yes from Bryant, Usher, M. Brown, Branscombe, Baechler. No from Orser, Swan, Henderson, Armstrong, Swan. That's 5-5 so far. #LdnOnt
Next, Coun. Bud Polhill. He says he's against it, too. "I've talked to a bunch of people too," he says. #LdnOnt
Armstrong says people in his ward "overwhelmingly" oppose this extra money for #Fanshawe. #LdnOnt
Fanshawe president Peter Devlin confirms the 400 students downtown are indeed "net new". The CitiPlaza students are separate. #LdnOnt
Armstrong wants to know how many #Fanshawe students are already downtown in CitiPlaza. How many "net" new students? #LdnOnt
Coun. Bill Armstrong, who last time said "no". Some were surprised by that then. #LdnOnt
Another impassioned speech from @MayorofLdnOnt. Will she sway anyone? Several neutral faces among "no" voters. #LdnOnt #Fanshawe
Baechler: "We are funding the revitalization of this downtown, which has an 11.2 vacancy rate." She denies it's education funding. #LdnOnt
Branscombe: "Let's do this. Let's vote tonight to make it happen." Next we have Mayor Baechler, who's spoken for this several times. #LdnOnt
Next, Coun. Nancy Branscombe is asking city staff some questions. We have some way to go before we get a decision. Several to speak. #LdnOnt
Swan says "most people" think KIngsmill's being saved, but hearts are broken when you tell them it will be "demolished". #LdnOnt
Swan: "We're here to get the best value for the tax dollar." #LdnOnt
Zuidema interrupted by Swan, who says he didn't want Zuidema's opinion all over again. Zuidema finishes anyway. #LdnOnt
City manager Art Zuidema: "I respectfully defer to Fanshawe College to run Fanshawe College." #LdnOnt
City manager: Brown's proposals don't "in our view" indicate the costs were too high. Ah, this is tense. Tweeting carefully here. #LdnOnt
Swan's compromise: Can city give the already-agreed $10 million while Fanshawe looks for a cheaper site? Staff to reply. #LdnOnt
Swan is again urging financial prudence on the Fanshawe deal. Says Matt Brown has shown he agrees the costs were too high. Uh-oh. #LdnOnt
Henderson instead proposes referring the issue to staff. He has no seconder. Next: Swan, who thanks Henderson for his contribution. #LdnOnt
Mayor interrupts Henderson, explaining he's presenting a new proposal and is out of order. Should vote for or against current plans. #LdnOnt
Henderson provided his idea to the media in advance. It focuses on Market Tower, with other arts, heritage, communications aspects. #LdnOnt
We've had a contribution from Coun. Harold Usher, saying yes. Now Coun. Dale Henderson details a different proposal for the deal. #LdnOnt
Orser: "I"m going to say no. It's not anything against Fanshawe. I'm a Fanshawe grad." #LdnOnt
Coun. Stephen Orser expressing concerns about costs of project, legality of BIA's involvement. #LdnOnt
Coun. Matt Brown presents two amendments, inc. city benefiting from any savings found during the tender process. #LdnOnt
Chief city planner John Fleming is outlining several reasons why he supports this proposal. Says it's a good investment for city. #LdnOnt
Coun. Judy Bryant opens the #Fanshawe debate by putting the $9 million request on the floor. She stresses support for the project. #LdnOnt

"This opportunity will walk out the door," downtown councillor Judy Bryant says. She's arguing for a "yes" to Fanshawe. #LdnOnt
"They're saying no." That's Van Meerbergen's assessment of public opinion on #Fanshawe's request for an extra $10 million. #LdnOnt
Pretty much everybody is speaking again, and reinforcing their comments from before. Van Meerbergen still refusing support. #LdnOnt
Fleming is speaking again. He only has to change one mind to get a "yes" for the Fanshawe/Kingsmill's deal. #LdnOnt
That Baechler/White exchange: Mayor suggested White take a break outside. White said Baechler should come too. #LdnOnt
Quite a lot of shouting, warning, apologizing going on here. Did anyone hear Baechler's appeal for good conduct earlier? #LdnOnt
Swan and Baechler appear to be debating the conduct of the meeting. Now White and Orser are getting involved. #LdnOnt
Chief city planner John Fleming answering questions. He wants this deal to go through. He came to council despite being on vacation. #LdnOnt
So that was 7-7 vote on referring this to staff. That means no referral. Now the main motion. If it's 7-7 again... Stick with us, #LdnOnt
We've counted seven in favour, seven against. That would kill the Fanshawe deal. Will the city manager's last-ditch appeal work? #LdnOnt
So much tension in this room. City staff making an appeal to councillors to support Fanshawe's $10 million request. #LdnOnt
Coun. Denise Brown speaks last. Does she carry the crucial vote? She says people don't want the Fanshawe deal. #LdnOnt
Usher favours the Fanshawe deal. This vote's going to be close. #LdnOnt
Coun. Russ Monteith says referring this back to staff is "an unknown". He says this deal is a win for downtown. #LdnOnt
Baechler gains applause from the gallery for her appeal to colleagues to vote for the Fanshawe/Kingsmill's deal. #LdnOnt
Now Baechler is saying she wants Fanshawe to get the money. The city invited the college downtown, she says. #LdnOnt
Coun. Sandy White also wants this Fanshawe/Kingsmill's deal shelved. #LdnOnt
There's also a deadline, as Coun. Bryant has pointed out, to keep alive the deal to buy the building from the Kingsmill family. #LdnOnt
City staff, in response to Coun. Hubert, confirm that referring Fanshawe question back for more study will mean a six-month delay. #LdnOnt
Matt Brown supports Fanshawe deal. If Joe Swan runs for mayor, they'll be rivals. (And yes, that may happen: http://t.co/XGl2fWftNj) #LdnOnt
Branscombe advocating support for Fanshawe. It'll save heritage, create jobs, she says. #LdnOnt
Coun. Armstrong supporting a move to refer the Fanshawe decision back to staff. We will have 14 people voting. Will this go through? #LdnOnt

Majority of councillors saying they want the new councillor to be former board of control member Russell Monteith. #LdnOnt

It's done. Mayor Baechler is now in office. It's all signed and sealed. #ldnont
The (soon to be) mayor is here. City clerk is clutching paperwork. Ceremony starts soon. #ldnont
Quite a crowd of media outside the mayor's office, where Joni Baechler is about to become mayor, officially. #ldnont
Three words: Mayor Joni Baechler. Get a load of this, #LdnOnt: http://t.co/F9KbqpmXRj
Former councillor Roger Caranci to run for mayor of London. http://t.co/XEAvaWdXoC #LdnOnt
As council continued, we headed to the city hall steps to hear ex-councillor Roger Caranci say he'll run for mayor. Story to come. #LdnOnt
Baechler receives standing ovation in council chamber. She speaks about the need for stability and to work together. #LdnOnt
Huge applause for Joni Baechler. Bud Polhill is the first to congratulate her. #LdnOnt
Third vote. Will anyone change their mind? Usher did. It's Baechler as interim mayor. #LdnOnt
We're going to have the same vote again, to "test the will of those who are voting," Swan says. #LdnOnt
Henderson and Usher vote Polhill. That's a 7-7 tie. Ah. #LdnOnt
If Henderson or Usher vote for Baechler, it's all over. (Assuming others don't change their votes.) #LdnOnt
Usher asks what happens if this ends in a tie. It's a good question. Swan says he'll tell him later. One procedure at a time. #LdnOnt
Usher and Henderson now drop out. It's Polhill vs Baechler, which is what many people predicted. #LdnOnt
First round is seven for Baechler; five for Polhill. Usher and Henderson each voted for themselves. #LdnOnt
Polhill has three votes; Baechler has four. #LdnOnt
Verbal vote is a lot funnier than anybody expected. People are shouting "yes" a lot. #LdnOnt
Now they vote. Each time, the last-placed candidate will drop out of the race. Again, it's Polhill, Baechler, Henderson and Usher. #LdnOnt
Did we miss Denise Brown? If so, she's not on the list of nominees. That is Polhill, Baechler, Henderson and Usher. #LdnOnt
Paul Van Meerbergen is a no, but Harold Usher is a yes. Judy Bryant declines. Sandy White says "No thank you." #LdnOnt
Bill Armstrong:no. Orser: no. Joni Baechler is a yes. Nancy Branscome and Matt Brown are both no. Hubert is no. Henderson: yes. #LdnOnt
Polhill says yes. #LdnOnt
First, the nominations. Every councillor will be asked if they want to stand. We begin with Ward 1, Bud Polhill. #LdnOnt
It begins. Coun. Joe Swan says council will now choose an interim mayor, based on the procedures agreed by council. #LdnOnt
Of course, there is a discussion about the noise wall on Veterans Memorial Parkway. That perennial issue, debated for 11 years. #ldNont
We're dealing with routine items as council waits for 5 p.m. to choose an interim mayor. #LdnOnt
@ericablonde It's all Slytherin.
We're on. City council is in session. The mace is in place. It's time to bring out the sorting hat. #LdnOnt
City council update: Orser is wearing a tie. Repeat: Orser is wearing a tie. We'll update you as events unfold. #LdnOnt
The councillors are gathering. There is an expectant hubbub. We'll update you as the magic happens. (Note: magic is unlikely.) #LdnOnt
How council will choose a new mayor tonight: http://t.co/NwCXfWtgtG That's our report of last night's fun and games at city hall. #LdnOnt
@Thomas_Howden Councillors are acting mayor in rotation. Whoever's next on the list (we don't know who) would step in.
It's live! LTC hooks up with Google Maps so Londoners can plan their journeys: http://t.co/aLzA2E9RG2 #LdnOnt
Councillors go off into their usual private meeting, promising to return at 5 and pick a new leader. #LdnOnt
@Thomas_Howden There's no need for crazy talk. This is complicated enough.
Did we miss an email about the dress code? There are a lot of suits and ties around the horseshoe tonight. Hmmm... #LdnOnt
And we are off. That interim mayor item is expected at around 5 p.m. The acting mayor (stay with us here) is Coun. Joe Swan. #LdnOnt
Deep breaths, #LdnOnt. It's almost time to choose a mayor. Council meeting is about to begin.

Council votes 14-0 in favour of city clerk's procedure. Tomorrow, every councillor will be asked if they want to be interim mayor. #LdnOnt
Coun. Bud Polhill just called for an end to "bickering" on council, in the interests of getting on with business. #LdnOnt
"Let's get this over with," says Coun. Denise Brown, in possibly the most popular statement made tonight. #LdnOnt
Orser just called for a full-time council. We've got to make that the drink word for council meetings. #LdnOnt
City clerk Cathy Saunders has worked out a voting procedure, to be used Tuesday night. Council about to vote on whether to use it. #LdnOnt
Council working out a voting system for choosing the interim mayor. It seems that each councillor will be asked if they want to run. #LdnOnt
The interim mayor will be chosen from council. Vote is 13-1 in favour. Only Orser disagreed. #LdnOnt
Couns. White and Hubert having a small disagreement. Hubert talked of "honour" needing to return to office of mayor. White objected. #LdnOnt
There's easily a majority of councillors in favour of appointing a councillor as interim mayor. #LdnOnt
Coun. Orser opposed to any sitting councillor. Wants to consider general public as potential mayors, including runner-up for mayor. #LdnOnt
Coun. Usher formally moves that a sitting councillor become mayor. A chorus of voices tries to second that. #LdnOnt
Council votes unanimously to declare the position of mayor vacant. #LdnOnt
A letter from "Mister Fontana." Thus does council say goodbye to its mayor. Swan speaks of "sadness and difficulty". #LdnOnt
Council was briefly in session there, with acting mayor Joe Swan presiding. They've gone off into a private meeting now. #LdnOnt
Final comments from public on #LdnPlan being invited. Nicole Worozbyt of the London Youth Advisory Council speaking. #LdnOnt
Looks like we're about to end this public participation meeting. Chief city planner John Fleming saying months of feedback to come. #LdnOnt
Series of #LdnPlan speakers: Stephen Turner, Michelle Baldwin, Bill Brock and now Nancy McSloy. Josh Morgan is next, then four more. #LdnOnt
David Bilson of rtraction is speaking out for agricultural land. He's the letter L on the list, which runs to R. #LdnOnt #LdnPlan
Catholic school board trustee Philip Squire criticizing #LdnPlan for not including school boards' views; opposes school closures. #LdnOnt
Jesse Helmer is current #LdnPlan speaker, with 12 to come. At five minutes each, that suggests the council meeting will start by 8. #LdnOnt
